posts.title: Activision Blizzard - Yay/Nay?
posts.body:
I am in the interview process for a fulltime position and I wanted to hear from people who have worked or interned at Activision in Santa Monica.

Do they pay well? Do they offer equity? Is the culture decent?  Is management any good?

comments.body:
It is probably worth it to work there a year or two to get the name on your resume. One of the few companies where name recognition would matter.

Its a pretty standard gamedev environment. Lower average pay and longer hours than other programming fields.
It should be great, long as you don't wrestle with Jeff.

Management in Santa Monica varies team to team. I never worked there, but they were a client of mine. Some of the teams were great to work with/for. Some of the teams were much less great. There were some very high ranking people who didn't know their ass from a hole in the ground, and there were some brilliant grunts doing awesome things.
